title: Granite Wash Mountains
text:
The Granite Wash Mountains are a short, arid, low elevation mountain range of western-central <a href="Arizona">Arizona</a>, in the southeast of <a href="La%20Paz%20County%2C%20Arizona">La Paz County</a>. The range borders a slightly larger range southeast, the <a href="Little%20Harquahala%20Mountains">Little Harquahala Mountains</a>; both ranges form a section on the same <a href="water%20divide">water divide</a> between two desert <a href="arroyo%20%28creek%29">wash</a>es. The washes flow in opposite directions, one northwest to the <a href="Colorado%20River">Colorado River</a>, the other southeast to the <a href="Gila%20River">Gila River</a>.
Description.
The range is northwest-by-southeast trending and is in a region of about thirty landforms, plains, valleys, and mountain ranges, called the <a href="Maria%20fold%20and%20thrust%20belt">Maria fold and thrust belt</a>. The region is in the <a href="Basin%20and%20Range%20Province">Basin and Range</a> and three mountain ranges are in a parallel, northwest-by-southeast trending <a href="thrust%20fault">thrust</a> belt, with two intervening valleys. The Granite Wash Mountains are attached to the southwest end of the <a href="Harcuvar%20Mountains">Harcuvar Mountains</a>, the center range of the 3 basin and range-thrusted mountains.
The Granite Wash range is on the same water divide as the Little Harquahala's and at the southwest end of the <a href="McMullen%20Valley">McMullen Valley</a>; to the east, the range and water divide forces the upland drainage areas of the <a href="Centennial%20Wash%20%28Maricopa%20County%29">Centennial Wash</a> to turn from southwest- to southeast-flowing towards the <a href="Gila%20River">Gila River</a> at the <a href="Gila%20Bend%20Mountains">Gila Bend Mountains</a>. To the west of the Granite Wash Mountains, the <a href="Bouse%20Wash">Bouse Wash</a> flows northwest to the <a href="Colorado%20River">Colorado River</a>, in the <a href="Lower%20Colorado%20River%20Valley">Lower Colorado River Valley</a>.

The highest elevation in the mountains is Salome Peak at , in the range's center. Salome Peak is located at .
<a href="Granite%20Wash%20Pass">Granite Wash Pass</a> is located at the northwest end of the southern mountain pair, the Little Harquahala's; <a href="Hope%2C%20Arizona">Hope</a> is west and <a href="Harcuvar%2C%20Arizona">Harcuvar, Arizona</a> is east. The pass contains the <a href="Arizona%20and%20California%20Railroad">Arizona and California Railroad</a> line, as well as <a href="U.S.%20Route%2060%20in%20Arizona">U.S. Route 60 in Arizona</a> form <a href="Brenda%2C%20Arizona">Brenda</a> at <a href="Interstate%2010%20in%20Arizona">Interstate 10 in Arizona</a>, and the route northeast to <a href="Aguila%2C%20Arizona">Aguila</a>, then to <a href="Wickenburg%2C%20Arizona">Wickenburg</a>, on <a href="U.S.%20Route%2093%20in%20Arizona">U.S. 93</a>.
Bouse Wash, Centennial Wash.
The Granite Wash and <a href="Little%20Harquahala%20Mountains">Little Harquahala Mountains</a> are on the northwest by southeast <a href="water%20divide">water divide</a> between two <a href="arroyo%20%28creek%29">wash</a>es. The <a href="Bouse%20Wash">Bouse Wash</a> flows northwest to the <a href="Colorado%20River">Colorado River</a>; <a href="Centennial%20Wash%20%28Maricopa%20County%29">Centennial Wash (Maricopa County)</a> is east and flows southeast to meet the <a href="Gila%20River">Gila River</a> at the great Gila Bend, adjacent the <a href="Gila%20Bend%20Mountains">Gila Bend Mountains</a>.
